titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Brian Carpenter

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:11-0400

did.abstract: Linguistic field recordings and interviews with consultant Frances Jack on Central Pomo language and culture. Includes elicitations of Central Pomo words and expressions (some untranslated), discussion of differences between different kinds of Pomo, folkloric stories, anecdotes about local healers, and description of domestic activities. Also includes interview and discussion in English about various healing practices and attitudes towards traditional beliefs.
did.physdesc: 12 sound cassettes (9 hr., 37 min.) : analog, 1 7/8 ips, stereo.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Presented by Marianne Mithun in 1986 (Acc. 1986-lr. S-B). This material was recorded with the assistance of a Phillips Fund grant.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Untranslated Central Pomo speech in two segments. May be a reading from a text. Contents of this program are not specified in the collector's documenation.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Audiocassette) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: First 14:00 consists of Central Pomo terms for plants, animals, and directions, most likely read from a list, with a small number of English equivalents given. Remainder of program consists of almost entirely untranslated Central Pomo words, phrases, and sentences. From 38:59 to 39:34 there is uncorrectable distortion originating from the RDAT copy of the recording.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Audiocassette) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of word lists and phrases in Central Pomo, with minimal English idenfication given. Much of the second half of program focuses on similar sounding phrases, and possible sound and syntax changes. Also includes description of caterpillar gathering and cooking, and discussion of homonyms. Severe, loud hum occurs at 18:24-18:28 and predominates at 22:29-23:31.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note

did.unittitle: Description of other Pomo speakers and miscellaneous expressions

scopecontent.p: Consists of anecdotes of other people known by the speaker who spoke Pomo in a different way, as well as English explanations of miscellaneous Central Pomo terms and expressions.

did.unittitle: Discussion in English of Central Pomo expressions and conversation in Central Pomo

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The second Central Pomo speaker is not identified on the recording nor in the collector's documentation. From 11:15 to 11:19 there are two loud, uncorrectable hums. The silent gap between these hums represents a 3-minute uninterrupted hum on the original recording that was edited out.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Interview consists of anecdotes given in English of sickness, attitudes towards local, traditional, and Christian healing practices, religious beliefs, and attitudes towards indigenous beliefs and practices. Includes multiple anecdotes about sick women and notable local healers.
